clinical_study.brief_title: Perfetti Method in Upper Extremity of Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Cognitive Sensory Motor Training Therapy on the Recovery of Upper Extremity Function in Acute Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The cognitive sensory motor training therapy (Perfetti's technique) might be more effectiveness than conventional occupational therapy on upper extremity function recovery after acute stroke patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Globally, stroke is the second leading cause of death above the age of 60 years, and the fifth leading cause of death in people aged 15 to 59 years old. Upper extremities problem is still faced with poor prognosis for recovery. Cognitive sensory motor training therapy (Perfetti's technique) might be better helped for recovery of upper extremity function in stroke than conventional therapy.

primary_outcome.description: The Action research arm test used for assess the impairment of upper limb function. ARAT has ordinal 4-point scale (0-3) in 19 items. Totally 57 scores.

secondary_outcome.description: For evaluated gross manual dexterity, consist of two adjacent boxes of the same size. Between the two boxes, there is a partition. It is recorded the number of wooden block that can be transported from one compartment of a box to another within 60 seconds
Basic activity of daily living and degree of independence from any form of help.

arm_group.description: Cognitive sensory motor training method for upper extremities rehabilitation every working day, totally training not less than 600 minutes within 4 weeks.
conventional occupational therapy method for upper extremities rehabilitation every working day, totally training not less than 600 minutes within 4 weeks.

intervention.description: training method that emphasis on cognition/ sensation/ and motor movement together train every working day 45 minutes per day for 4 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First ever stroke
- Impaired upper extremity function
- Given signed inform consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable medical condition
- Any upper extremity functional impairment prior to stroke
- Can not adequately cooperate in training
- Severe communication problems
- Severe cognitive - perceptual deficits
- Fixed contracture more than 30 degree in every upper extremity joint
